meanings.definition: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash of red spots on the skin.
meanings.sent1: After getting chickenpox, my little sister had red spots all over her body.
meanings.sent2: The school had to send a notice home because of a chickenpox outbreak.
meanings.sent3: The chickenpox rash made Tim look like a polka-dotted superhero.
meanings.sent4: The spread of rumors in the office was like a chickenpox epidemic, infecting everyone with curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that chickenpox is like a tiny army invading the body with red spots.

meanings.definition: A disease primarily affecting children, characterized by fever and the eruption of red spots on the skin.
meanings.sent1: When my daughter had chickenpox, she had to stay home from school.
meanings.sent2: The pediatrician confirmed that it was indeed chickenpox that the child had.
meanings.sent3: The chickenpox outbreak at the daycare led to a lot of itchy children.
meanings.sent4: The sudden surge in demand for calamine lotion was like a chickenpox fever taking over the town.
meanings.sent5: The school nurse described chickenpox as a sneaky illness that loves to make kids scratch.
